title: 6 Easy Steps to Make Bullet Lists in a PowerPoint Presentation

steps.title: Open a PowerPoint presentation.
steps.content: Open a PowerPoint presentation. Double-click an existing PowerPoint presentation , or open PowerPoint and create a new presentation . [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select the slide you want to type on.
steps.content: Select the slide you want to type on. Click a slide on the left side of the window to open the slide you want to place your bullet point on. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Alternatively, you can create a new slide. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you don't see the slides of your PowerPoint on the left side of your screen, go to "View > Normal."

steps.title: Select a place to enter text.
steps.content: Select a place to enter text. Click one of the text areas on the slide to place your cursor there. For example, you might click the "Title" box or the "Click to add text" box. If there's text that you want to add bullet points to, select that text instead.

steps.title: Click the Home tab.
steps.content: Click the Home tab. It's in the top-left section of the PowerPoint ribbon, which is the orange band atop the PowerPoint window. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you're using a Mac, the Home tab is different than the Home menu item that's in the top-left side of your Mac's screen.

steps.title: Select a bullet point format.
steps.content: Select a bullet point format. Click one of the three-lined icons in the upper-left side of the "Paragraph" section in the Home toolbar. You will have at least two options: standard bullet points, and numbered bullet points. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you have an existing list of items you want to turn into bullet points, highlight them before selecting a bullet point format. This will add a bullet point to each individual line. You can also click in the top-right corner of a bullet point option to see different styles for that bullet point type. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Create your bullet list.
steps.content: Create your bullet list. Type a word or phrase for your first bullet, then press â†µ Enter . This will create a bullet point for the first item and then create a new bullet point for your next item. If you're in a "Text" box, a new bulleted line will be created when you press "Enter/Return" but not if you're in a "Title" box. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Press the Backspace key while your cursor is next to a new bullet point to stop using bullet points. *You can use different PowerPoint bullet formats to differentiate sub-points from main points. To do this, use the "Increase List Level" or press Tab on your keyboard.
